38874007.review: Bueno, despues de un par de horas bien jugadas, puedo decir que sigue siendo el mismo juegazo que tuve el privilegio de pasar, por donde lo vea, super comodos los controles con el teclado, las mismas mecanicas nada aburridad, un juego de plataformas de la vieja escuela que eras increible antes y ahora despues del remaster, sigue siendo increible, hicieron un trabajo estupendo mis felicitaciones, la nostalgia se invadio de mi en todo momento, cada nivel que volvi a pasar :)

38844076.review:
I regret buying this game.

The controls are uncomfortable and there is no option to remap them. The cutscenes are long, frequent, and worst of all, unskippable. There is no ability to save your progress in the game until you have beaten an entire level. That means that if you die partway through a level, you have to start completely over. In the middle of a long level and want to quit and resume later? Tough luck, all your progress is gone. The game also frequently doesn't give you any real instructions on what items do or what your objectives are. I get the sense that whoever designed this game has never played a 3D platformer before and does not understand what players value in these types of games. I've never written a game review before, but the absolute frustration from trying to play this fun looking game has driven me to highly recommend NOT BUYING.

36851432.review: Wonderful Nostalgia is all I can say about this. Thanks for bringing back part of my childhood. A must have for original Xbox Owners.

36595050.review:
I am super excited to write this review as I am nearly finished my first run through of the game! 

First and foremost, I have been waiting for this classic to be brought back to life since playing it on the original Xbox during my childhood! This game is a great classic, and replaying it again in it's remastered form presents no disappointments! There are some remastered games that I've played and realized that it no longer seems as fun as it did back then-but Voodoo Vince still has not lost it's spark. 

It's got a unique gameplay due to the aspects of openly looking to want to hurt yourself to cause chaos to enemies around you. That's voodoo for you! The cast of characters in this game also make the gameplay quite fun to play. Especially when listening to Vince's snarky remarks, haha. And although each boss fight does include Vince finding a way to hurt himself to cause pain to the boss, each fight is unique and never feels overly repetitive!
In account: I've lived in New Orleans, Louisiana all of my life-yet as a child, I never really understood the scenario of this game. Back then, I didn't really explore places in the city-now that I'm older, I understand a lot of these cool references regarding my hometown and it really is quite fascinating. 



Overall, I do recommend this on the PC. Not many people know how to get the ports just right and the configuration for these old console games to PC can get frustrating and may include having to download third party support drivers, yet they've done it right with this one. I decided to try playing this game using keyboard and mouse and it seems perfectly fluid to me. I honestly have not noticed any bugs in the game. 
As for new players, all I can say is that when I introduced this game to others-they really enjoyed the aspect of the game. It's different, which is hard to find in most games now-a-days. 

Thumbs up from me! I absolutely love most of the original xbox game classics-I'm extremely happy to see this hidden gem discovered and remastered for me to relive again.

36453730.review:
Voodoo Vince is one of those hidden gems, along with Psychonauts and some others. The game is from 2003 but still holds up pretty well. I didn't get the chance to play it on the original Xbox (never heard of it at the time), but it definitely reminds me of great action/adventure games of that era.

Pros :
+ nice "Pixar meets Tim Burton" art style with varied environments.
+ good level design with lots of variations (somehow reminds me of Rayman 2 and Psychonauts).
+ well handled controls, at least with a controller. Feels a bit like the first Jak & Daxter. I played it with a Xbox 360 pad (haven't tried it with a keyboard, but I'd recommend playing it with a controller).
+ good voice acting with some funny moments.
+ nice soundtrack.
+ lots of voodoo attacks, many kinds of monsters, memorable bosses, lots of stuff to collect.

Cons :
- the train destination menu is a bit confusing.
- the remastered graphics look nice, but a few parts still have very blurry textures (the walls during the fight with Dolly, for example).

If you like good old action/adventure 3D platformers, this game is a must buy. Definitely worth the price.

36412461.review: this game is my child hood if you like 3D platformers this is a must have

34676090.review:
Voodoo Vince was one of those obscure Original Xbox games that didn't get much attention. 

While this game itches a satisfy nostalgia itch, there are more reasons this game deserves some praise.

Original xbox emulation isn't easy, same goes for trying to port these type of games. 

The pros and cons will be written with new-players in mind. For nostalgia players, this game is a must-buy. There is nothing I have to say convince you, it's a proper remaster. But for those who have never even heard of Voodoo Vince before, this is what you want to hear
--------------------------------
PROS:

-1080p 60+fps
-Controller support
-Updated textures from the original (2003 release)
-Smooth Platforming
-Foot-tapping soundtrack (Majority of which is Jazz)
-Rememberable voice acting, such as the main character Vince (Ken Boynton).
-Hubworlds with unique level design
-Devs that respond to community upsets via quality of life patches

CONS:
-Besides steam achievements, there isn't any sort of incentive to collect everything the game offers.
-Platforming can be unforgiving. With lives, you can find yourself resetting to the last checkpoint with a certain tricky spot.

MILD UPSETS:
-No 4k VR support or paid mods ;-)

--------------------------------

TL;DR: Voodoo Vince Remastered does pretty well for a 2003 xbox game. It's a lot like the TY remasters, the devs are listening to the community trying to make patchfixes that improve the quality of the game. If you ever played Voodoo Vince before, this is a must-buy. If you've never heard of the game, and are interested in platformers, it is worth the risk in my opinion.

34555660.review: Nostalgia managed to hurt my wallet and Vince's face

34398863.review:
This game lacks something a LOT of games have. And that is Bull Stuff.
The Devs keep this game up to date to keep it clean and fresh and fun to play again and again. A hidden gem for the OG XBox, and Phil Spencer himself has said this was his favorite game he has ever got to work with on. This is a man who worked on Halo, Fable, and Gears of War. And on top of all that he picks Voodoo Vince. And that says a WHOLE lot about how good this game is. A Must Buy for any 3D Platformer fans out there.

34230128.review:
Despues de 11 horas de juego y completarlo al 100% con sus logros, ahora si puedo hacer esta reseña^^
Hace aproximadamente 11 años "Voodoo vince" fue uno de los primeros juegos que tuve cuando mis padres me compraron mi "Xbox: primera generacion". Fue uno de los pocos juegos que pude entender, (ya que estaba en español XD) y le dedique muchas horas de juego a este.
Ahora en 2017, pude volver a jugar y sentir los buenos momentos de este mitico juego, recordando a los personajes, las misiones, los jefes y mas.

Lo bueno del remaster: -
Conserva casi absolutamente todo del juego original, hubo cambios muuuyyy ligeros, pero aun asi estubo bien ^^

Lo malo del remaster:
-No se si se deba a un detalle en mi PC, pero el juego me dio un poco de lag, supuestamente no deberia pasar eso, ya que son graficas del 2002 (Aproximadamente), supuestamente se deberia reproducir sin problemas. En ciertas partes del juego, las animaciones se encontraban atrasados respecto a los dialogos de los personajes, yo digo que esta un poco mal optimisado
-En el nivel: "Agua, Tierra y Madera" La musica del fondo es diferente, originlmente la musica de fondo tenia un tono mas relajante, ahora le pusieron una musica mas.... Acelerada, por asi decirlo, personalmente no me gusto aquella musica, siento que estoy bajo presion :s

Yo me esperaba que en este remaster habria mas misiones, mas jefes, o mas dificultad, pero no. 
Aun asi estubo muy  bien este remaster ^^

34155586.review: cosmo can suck my dick / / vince is my queen ; \/ }

34119723.review: Not much of a remaster; but a good port of a great game.

33923953.review:
My first experience with Voodoo Vince:

- Got into the main menu screen and instantly got hit by a brick of nostalgia
- Loaded up the game and became overwhelmed with joy

If you knew what this game was back in 200X when it came out and you enjoyed it then, I really can't say much more than pick it up again. If you were anything like me when I first played it as a wee little fetus who had barely escaped the clutches of my mothers loins and you enjoyed it then and even had good memories with it then just buy it again and get hit with that same brick that hit me and (I hope) many others. 

However, if you haven't played the game I'm not sure if you'll enjoy yourself. Although its an amazing game with a great overall theme (the whole, almost suicidal doll, Jazz music and style), it isn't without its problems that certainly come up today. 

The enchanced graphical improvements really make the remaster something for older players returning to the game it's still nice if you're jumping in for the first time. Now, on to the outstanding problems I have with the game. 

- Firstly, the game itself when compared to other platformers out there it doesn't do anything new as far as platformers go. You've got the standard normal punch attack, followed along by the legendary helicopter attack that completely eliminates the purpose of the punch attack. 

- Secondly, the boss fights in the game are rather easy and tedious at times, because I only found myself dying by my own hands. Whether I press a wrong key and tumble to my demise or stop paying attention and run into the boss on accident with little to no health.

- At times the camera feels... Unnatural and has to be fought with every now and again just to get out of Vince's velvety asshole so you can finally identify those growling noises you've been hearing for the passed 2.5 milliseconds. 

- Some levels/sections can become tedious *cough* I'M LOOKING AT YOU SECTION WHERE YOU HAVE TO BUILD THAT FUCKING HOT AIR BALLOON *cough*. This may be due to me remembering as soon as I saw the loading screen for that section and thinking: "Oh fuck I remember this bullshit." And then procceded to wade through that bullshit to move on.

- You basically have an infinite amount of hearts (which are things you find scattered throughout a level to obtain more lives) ( also I'm pretty sure this was in the older version too). Because whenever you boot the game up you can travel back to a previous location and the hearts will all respawn in the same locations. I don't know if this was on purpose or not but it somewhat takes away from the sense of danger the game has. Even if you never use it you always know you can just "go back" if you're left on a single heart.

All in all if you like a well-grounded, interesting and amusing at times platformer (and can of course excuse the faults) then by all means pick it up. Because myabe... someday... We might just get a sequal... Who the fuck am I kidding, we're never getting that shit.

33413726.review:
This was one of my first ever video games that I got when I was 6, and in junior high when I got an xbox 360 this game couldnt be played on it. For years I've been searching for ways to play it again. My boyfriend even tried to figure out a way to burn it on a disk from a file he got, and it /almost/ worked, but not quite. It's been years, and suddenly I see there's a new remastered version on Steam.\
You can imagine my happiness. 
This game is the first I ever played, and still my favourite to this day. It's incredibly creative and every level is different. Witty and hilarious, the comedy works for all ages. It's funny enough that I laughed when I was 6, and even now replaying it im understanding jokes that I wouldn't have as a kid. 
I HIGHLY recommend this game. Everyone should play it, imo. It has a special place in my heart and I really believe it'll earn one in yours too.

33404899.review:
A hidden gem against all the odds finds its way onto steam. Voodoo Vince is a 3D platformer of the original xbox, but what makes it special is the unique tone, environments and approach to level design. The wacky soundtrack and unusual settings feel fresh and inspired. Unlike the traditional sand, ice or fire levels seen in other games you will be exploring warped towns, twisted crypts and more. 

But besides the setting; Gameplay in Voodoo Vince is unique as well. Many of the puzzles and ways of defeating enemies are spun on their head as you try to find ways to hurt yourself and activate your voodoo powers. There is still traditional combat but it takes a backseat to these puzzle elements. Levels are at their strongest when they revolve around trying to find creative ways to tackle a problem, such as lighting yourself on fire to blow up some angry gas canisters. The first area is the best example of this, every problem is so unique and the characters are charming. However some later levels that focus solely on platforming or combat feel mediocore.

Many platformers struggle to maintain player interest in collecting all of it's item's but luckily Vince handles this in a perfect way. All collectables that you find have a direct impact on gameplay. Collecting the zombie dust grants you an extra health bar for every 100. The voodoo idols give you different animations for when you use your voodoo powers and the skulls allow you to use these voodoo powers more often. Collectables are also not overbearing. Besides a few exceptions levels are small and well focused. You'll rarely feel like collecting everything is becoming a chore.

But as with all games it does have it's flaws. When you run into one of these mediocore levels the cracks start to show dramatically. Odd ledge detection, massive hitboxes (on just about everything), and strange depth perception can ruin the pace. Voodoo Vince does much better as an exploration based game than it ever could with it's platforming. this might turn off the hardcore fans of other more well known games in the genre. But all in all it's a good game oozing with style and originality. Props to microsoft for allowing this cult classic to make it's way to PC.

33340216.review:
Un 3d plataformas muy divertido y "original" que vale cada centimo que cuesta, lo de "original" es por que aunque no imnova nada si trae algunas cosillas que yo al menos no vi en otros plataformas de este estilo y son algo frescas (mecanicas).
--Bueno--
-Historia divertida sin dudas, nada de reflexionar o cosas asi, esto es para divertirse
-Mecanicas bastante buenas tanto en combate como en los poderes que siempre es divertido usarlos
-Rejugable en cada nivel y con muchos desafios diferentes
-Bosses de puzzles y plataformeo
-Mucha exploracion de zona para cada nivel y sus colecionables.
--Malo--
-La manera de guardar partida es un poco rara
-No tiene coop ni ningun modo arcade
-No dura mas de 10/12 horas
-Los poderes son automaticos, solo es pulsar un boton y sale el poder automaticoç
--Conclusion--
Es un plataformas muy recomendado sin dudas y que va genial en rendimiento.

32661162.review:
I never heard of this game prior to its Steam release, but I am so glad I bought it. As a fan of 3D platformers, this game was really fun. It reminds me of Psychonauts and Conker Bad Fur Day in a lot of ways. Great and dark worlds, funny dialoge, awesome bosses and supporting characters, great music and just fun to play! Vince himself is a really nice character, and his voodoo abilities are really fun to use.
My only complain is that you cant go back to the levels once you finish the game. I was lucky to find all the collectables in my first run though.

32519755.review:
Voodoo Vince: Remastered gets all the nostalgia quite perfectly. I can tell you that this game for the original Xbox was one of my favorite things back in my childhood years and, really, the team that brought us this remaster didn't have much work ahead of them other than bringing the original graphics to a more modern standard. 

The platforming is awesome, the characters very original and charismatic, the story is fun but simple and the worlds are varied and unfolding. This game can be enjoyed by the old players, like me, who have loved this game since the prehistoric times of the original Xbox and for the new players who want to give Vince a try for the first time. 

The only thing I wish the developers had done was adding some sort of extra content. Although the game is great fun, it is quite short and the "remaster" refers only to the graphics and (at least at the date this review was written) no new content has been given to Voodoo Vince. Other remastered games like Age of Empires II gave us some new content here on Steam and I really do wish these guys are able to do just that. 

As the final note, I'd like to add that, the soundtrack to this game is one of the best videogame soundtracks ever written. Jazz, Blues and Rock all mix together in this perfect New Orleans vibe that gets all the whimsical, satyrical and witty fun this game has perfectly. I really do wish they release a soundtrack soon.

Voodoo Vince: Remastered is a great game for people who havent tried voodoo vince and an amazing nolstalgic expirence for people who played Voodoo Vince on the orginal Xbox. Phil spencer really stepped up and showed that at his heart his a gamer and not afraid to make/remaster games that may not bring in a lot of revenue. Voodoo Vince: Remastered has made me take a diffrent outlook to xbox as a brand entirely.

[b]Pros[/b]
- Great soundtrack
- Great humour 
- Constantly being updated and the devs are keeping good communication

[b]Cons[/b]

Go buy this game right now

Pros
- Great Port, consistant framerate and in sync audio
- Great Characters
- Good sense of humor

- Cool level design
- Lots of gameplay variety
- Bosses are memorable 
- Controls are responsive and it's fun to kill things

Cons
- Keyboard and Mouse controllers feel a bit weird

Overall still a great game. I recommend picking it up. I hope more forgotten platformer games get ported to Steam and are just as good as this one

31534639.review:
Voodoo Vince Remastered is a fun and entertaining game, for $14.99 you're getting something that is full of value that will last between 7-10 hours because of all the different things you can do in this game. I would recommend Voodoo Vince to people who like playing action/adventure games such as Ratchet & Clank, Ty the Tasmanian Tiger or Blinx the Time Sweeper. What you'll like about the game is its colorful cast of characters, fun mini games, and challenge. however what you will dislike about it is its simplistic combat that can be pretty repetitive and its platforming that can be hard at times especially towards the end of the game but overall it will leave a sweet aftertaste even since its 2003 release.

PROS:

+ Colorful cast of characters
+ Fun mini games 
+ Remaster done right for an old game 
+ Entertaining boss battles

CONS:

- Simplistic combat that's too easy
- Platforming can be difficult at times

Read the full review + video at https://www.keengamer.com/article/16155_voodoo-vince-remastered-review

Gostei muito desse jogo, é divertido e bem variado. Ele é um jogo de plataforma com muitos puzzles e um sistema de combate legal (embora simples). Gostei muito dos veículos usados no jogo, eles dão uma boa mudança no gameplay. O personagem Vince é extremamente carismático e a trilha sonoro é muito agradável. Mas nem tudo é bom. O jogo tem problema sério no pulo, causando frustação. Pelo menos esses bugs não ocorrem com frequência. O gráfico é outro ponto negativo, pois parece que só remasterizam o Vince e se esqueceram do cenário e dos outros personagem. Claro que, pelo preço cobrado (apenas R$ 27,00) da pra perdoar o grafico,

31370409.review: Game runs great. Loving the xbox originals. Fingers crossed for Conker: Live and Reloaded.

31361028.review:
Voodoo Vince: Remastered is a terrific 3D platformer, with sharp writing and wit, creative level and enemy design, and a unique and upbeat soundtrack to fit its many themed levels, such as its classic New Orleans' Jazz vibe.

The performance options are quite limited, with preset low, medium and high settings for fullscreen or windowed, but otherwise the game runs beautifully and looks like a remastered classic should. After a couple of patches by the developers, the game runs perfectly fine at 100 fps (the engine cap I think, maybe it's around 100 or 110). I have only very limited playtime with a keyboard+mouse use, but I would strongly recommend using a controller to play this, although it supports seamless transition between input methods, with UI and buttom prompts changing on-the-fly.

Anyone who played the original Xbox version will enjoy this faithful remaster, and anyone new to the game will enjoy the creative and challenging platforming and puzzles, and will certainly laugh at the crazy characters Vince meets on his journey.

Reviewed after finishing the game in its entirety.

Edit: Nomiated for The “Suspension of Disbelief” Award

31353027.review: my First Gmae at the age of 5 <3 i love it so much, thanks for leting me play it agin :), made this kid happy

31347981.review:
[h1]Voodoo Vince: Remastered is a an amazing next-gen port (sans PS4, unfortunately) of the original X-Box Puzzle Platformer Voodoo Vince![/h1]

Ever since I got the original version of the game back in 2010, I found myself always coming back to play through the game at least once a year, and now I can do that in high definition on my PC without having to hook up the old X-Box.

The graphics have been updated phenomenally considering this was an X-Box launch title, as well as clean-cut sound files to make the game look and sound amazing.

[h1]The Story[/h1]
The game stars a 10-inch voodoo doll named Vince who is brought to life by the spilled Zombie Dust stolen by the game's antagonist, Cosmo The Inscrutable, along with his henchmen who have also captured the owner of the voodoo shop and Vince's creator, Madame Charmaine. Vince, with his voodoo magic, must track down Cosmo and rescue Charmaine while meeting and beating a vast crew of comical characters through several levels of puzzle-platforming action.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Gameplay for Voodoo Vince is relatively simple yet deviously entertaining.[list]
[*]Vince has several moves in addition to the basic run, jump and punch.
[*]He can use a spin attack to damage enemies, knocking them back, while also providing as an extension of your jumps.
[*]While in the air, Vince can hover to descend slowly, covering more distance while in the air.
[*]Vince can also use a head slam attack while mid-air which is more effective on specific enemies.
[*]Eventually in the game, Vince will find a special pin which can be used to grapple from targets placed within levels.
[/list]
Damaging and killing enemies will cause them to drop beads, filling a meter that, when full, allows Vince to use a Voodoo Power, hurting himself in various comical ways which will gratuitously yield the same painful death to all enemies close enough to Vince.

Throughout most levels are several bags of Zombie Dust, which can increase your health with every 100 bags collected.
Some levels contain Skull Pages which, when all are collected in an area, will conjure a Power Skull, which Vince can chase down and collect to expand the count of Voodoo Powers he can hold at once.

[h1]Minor downsides which may be fixed[/h1][list]
[*]There is currently a bug causing a loud sound to play when pausing and unpausing as well as when HUD elements disappear
[*]The key for hovering and first person view are currently the same, and cannot be bound differently, this can cause annoying toggles to first person view when holding hover as you land
[*]There is a sequence in the final levels in which you are flying a plane. Rotating the plane's axis counter-clockwise and firing the plane's guns are currently mapped to the same key and cannot be bound differently. You will have to spin while shooting.

Overall, this game is a masterpiece, even now after its original release 14 years ago. Well worth the $15 price tag and will provide an experience you won't be forgetting


9.5/10

I loved this game as a kid. I was blown away when I saw that they were remaking it. This game is my favorite platformer because of its charm and wit as well as its fantastic level design (for the time).

31302255.review:
Voodoo Vince is a bit of a period piece: The voice acting and basic plot remind me of the Saturday morning cartoons of the 80's and 90's. If you don't mind a little campiness (and I don't at all) this games storyline will bring you back to simpler times. That said where a game like this makes it or breaks it is on the strength of it's platforming and puzzling. Fortunately Voodoo Vince succeeds at both. While the camera is not 100% perfect, it's not bad and the controls feel spot-on -- not a common thing in platformers from the early 2000's.  Graphics are nice and crisp and I like the soundtrack quite a bit. If you have a low end PC there are settings to scale things down a bit and obviously any gaming PC will run it nicely. If you missed this game on the original XBox or just want to re-live good times Voodoo Vince is well woth putting some time into.

GPD Win based review/ let's play linked: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HaUn_tVOQw0

The game is really easy, not much of a challenge. Music is good.

Random holes in the levels that are hard to see, thanks to the camera.

Had some problems with the swing, if you touch the floor at the edge of a pit while swinging, the swing animation will end and you will drop to your death.

If you're aware of the old Xbox game and just want to know how the port is: It's pretty great. It ran in 4K 60fps the whole time. No particular glitches, everything ran smooth.

If you are unaware of what this game is: Voodoo Vince is a charming platformer from the original Xbox. The game is funny, fast paced, and damn fun to play. The story is light, no overly long cutscenes or qtes, just platforming fun. A truly great example of how games used to be that hasn't aged a day. The controls are solid, the camera works well, you'll hardly notice the game is 13 years old (it helps that the textures have been redone). Took me about 8 hours to 100% it.

31228632.review:
I've only played 72 mins on steam, and I am currently (the time of writing this review) at the 5th stage, not sure how far I am from the end but im guessing still pretty far.

Voodoo Vince is a fun little Platformer/Puzzle with a quirky and funny character. The villians are pretty goofy and it has an all round fun story.

The combat isn't bad, although flying enemies are a huge pain, it has a fun use of the voodoo doll letting you use voodoo spells to kill multiple enemies. Being a port from consol to pc, the controls are pretty clean, I haven't really had any troubles so far.

Im going to mark down what I like and don't like (P.S i have played this on consol when i was younger, so I will probably be a lot less harsher than 'actual' critics, this game gives me so much nostalgia that I can't truly hate it)

What I like:
The character - Hes funny and very different which makes him more loveable.
The villans - The villans are super goofy and fun to play againts.
The combat - The voodoo spells are really cool and its not a bad combat system, although its very basic, its still kind of entertaining.
The maps - The areas are so intresting, its odd shapes and interesting uses of pipes from the ground makes it all the more fun to explore
The narrator - The narrator has such a nice voice and fits really well the theme of 'voodoo'. Its great to have a nice clear woman narrator instead of a generic deep male voice narrator

What I dislike:
The sometimes frustraiting camera angles - Sometimes its very annoying to have a camera not cooperating with you and it happens quite often, although you can have a 360 view by pressing ctrl (for keyboared) it still shifts back it to right afterwards which isn't fun at all.Not being able to choose a voodoo power - You collect various voodoo powers in the game, and some are more cool and or interesting to use than others, and it really sucks that it chooses which one at random, although it doesn't make any actual difference and the animations are purely for variety, it would be fun to choose some that you want to use, but again, in the end it all has the same affect, to kill a bunch of enemies in a area.

No new voiceovers: Although I understand why It probably didn't happen, I would have enjoyed it if the voiceover for the Narrator would have changed for players using the keyboared (I.e isteand of saying 'Press the Y button' it would say 'Press the __ Key'. Although this is irrelevent if you play this on a controler ;P

Final thoughts: This game was defenitly worth the money and Im not even close to the end! I had a little more, you could say, encouragement to buy this game since it was a cherished childhood memory to play it on the first xbox. But I truly think that even if you've never seen or heard of this game before, you should buy it and enjoy it! Its fun and goofy with a decent storyline, it have some familiar elements that you see in a lot of games, but it adds its own twists! 

Final Rating, 8.5/10 -Great fun!

31219029.review:
I never played this game back in the day, but I do have a love for the original Xbox and unfortunately many classic and underrated games from that system remain out of reach for many gamers today. This game was one of those, previously only playable on an original xbox. It's now been brought back to steam, remastered for everyone to enjoy! this is a very solid remastering. 

Arbitrary resolutions
60 fps (higher possible but others claim it is buggy, have not tried for myself}
higher resolution assests
keyboard and mouse support 
of course, controller support with xbox one prompts

The game is also very stable for me atleast. no crashing or weird bugs seen. There is one particular issue where Anisotropic filtering is on a low setting, forcing through your respective graphics card options menu seems to do the trick. 

Aside from all the technical things, this is a very enjoyable game that should satisfy anyone whos ever enjoyed a platformer from that era of video games. Controls feel tight, camera can be a bit weird at times but this was common for games of that era. 

Overrall solid effort 10/10

31218894.review:
Underrated gem which I remember playing since I was 4. Nostalgia aside, the game is a neat platformer with charm and good level design, however I was surprised how my laptop (toaster) survived against minimum specs.

Minimum: Dedicated card with 1gb VRAM.
What I have: Crappy AMD processor with integrated graphics from 6 years ago (512mb VRAM).
Results: 15-40 fps (playable mostly, hovers from 24-35 for the most part).

Very happy with this remaster and the level of optimisation here.

31213909.review:
[h1] Great Job Guys! [/h1]

TLDR: Great game from launch little to no bugs and a great platformer worth the price!


So heres my opinion, the game looks great smooth frames little to no problems and nostolgia factor is through the roof! I owned this game as a kid on Xbox but never got super far, I'm so glad to see its return in its beautiful remaster! I've played for a few hours since launch and have had only one problem and that is [u]when you unplug a listening device and try to use the sound from your speakers the sound with not work even if you were to plug the listening device back in.[/u] I dont know if thats a hardware problem or a game problem but its a very insignificant problem and the only bump in the road.

[h1] For Any Newcomers to The Game [/h1]

Honestly it's a good platformer from an era that did not shove everything down your throat and force you to play a tutorial. Almost everything in the game is trial and error and almost always self explanitory my only suggestion would be to play through to a save on a new stage if you were to stop playing. It really is worth the price of $15 and is a steal at its price!

31213904.review: its voodoo vince and it runs perfectly

31213803.review:
Este juego fue parte de mi infancia desde que lo compré hace 12 años atrás.
lo conocí en una demo dentro del disco de halo combat envolved como extras o algo así, siempre jugaba esa demo porque me gustaba este estilo y plataformero de voodoo vince, le pedía tanto a mis padres que me compraran este juego cuando saliera, pasó el tiempo y fue en tiempo de navidad cuando había como ofertas en una tienda donde venden ropa y perfumes (fabricas de francia) mientras estaba en esa tienda, mi hermano se fue a comprar unos juegos, cuando ya era hora de irnos, regreso con 3 juegos diferentes, 2 de que le gustaron a él y de sorpresa también compró el voodoo vince, me quede lleno de felicidad cuando vi que lo tenia en mis manos, siempre lo jugaba, en total me lo pasaba 15 veces al año, fue cuando pasó mucho tiempo y el disco iba rayándose pero no pasaba nada malo, aun servia y jalaba bien el disco, pero el problema fue que lo perdí y nunca pude encontrarlo, fue como un corto tiempo de depresión cuando me enteré que nunca lo iba a encontrar, pasaron muchos años, obtuve mi primer pc y me puse a investigar si había una forma de como jugar voodoo vince y se podía pero quemandolo en un disco y tener el xbox oiginal chipeado, hasta que me cansé de investigar, mientras investigaba, iba viendo que microsoft se estaba olvidando sobre este juego, que nunca iba a regresar, y me deprimí de más, fue cuando el año pasado estaba todo tranquilo y me dio por curiosidad de ver en el apartado de steam "greenlight" y me puse a ver juegos de otras personas hasta que me tope que voodoo vince estaba entre esos juegos, rápidamente me hypie de ver el trailer, estaba llorando de felicidad de que porfin voodoo vince regresaría a volver a jugarlo.

31213532.review:
[h1]Rating: 10/10[/h1]
It's really funny because a few days ago I was on YouTube looking for the Voodoo Vince SoundTrack, as I was wanting to feel some nostalgia. Anyway as I had typed 'Voodoo Vince', the suggestions came up with "Voodoo Vince Remastered" and I was like lol nah that can't be real. I watched the trailer and here I am now. This was [i](still is)[/i] one of my favourite games from my childhood and I'm so stoked that Beep Games, Inc. actually remastered this game.

If you enjoy platformers I highly recommend this game.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*]Fun gameplay
[*]HD Graphics
[*]Constant 60 Fps
[*]Nostalgiac for people who owned this game
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*]Pressing escape in the main menu closes the game
[*]No mouse support for the main menu/pause menu. (You need to use arrow keys)
[*][strike]Playing in fullscreen windowed mode with a monitor with a refresh rate higher than 60 causes the game to speed up accordingly to the refresh rate. (I'm aware the game has just come out and will hopefully be fixed soon)[/strike]
[/list]

That's all I have to say about this, so many memories are flowing back to me as I play this game. Thanks for reading my review.
[i]I'll change the cons list if the bug ever gets fixed :)[/i]

31213155.review:
A classic game from the original Xbox, now remastered for Steam. This game has impressed me with it's release. Runs flawless without FPS dips or crashes. Just about everything I have to say about this game is positive, aside for some minor things like the pausing sound effect being really loud compared to everything else. But overall, solid gameplay and a good remaster.

10/10

31212987.review: So far so good.  HOWEVER, the game logic is tied to the framerate.  Playing in fullscreen seems to lock it at 60, but borderless fullscreen can present a problem if you use a display higher than 60hz.

31212638.review:
[h1] 60 FPS NOSTALGIA (EDITED) [/h1]

This is a masterpiece and its remastered perfectly.

[h1] Pros [/h1]
+ Solid FPS for a Remaster
+ HD Quality textures for everything (plus cutscenes)
+ Smoother movements
+ Same feeling as the original game nothing changed in gameplay

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

[h1] Most of the cons have been fixed so I just removed them entirely as I do not have any issues with them anymore myself however could still arise for other users. Anyway this is worth the amount it wants as its a proper remaster of an old time classic and one of my favourite games. [/h1]
